description:
This is an annual attempt of M31. 

There are many challneges as usual. The weather, the hardware and the processing. 

I remember the thrill when I first manually go-to the M31 through a C8. The little fuzzy light ball in the center of eye piece was merely the center of this magnificent giant. Yet it was sufficient to keep my goosebumps up for a significant while. 

Since then, I paid an annual tribute to the very target. It becomes a reference for me. And every year I tried to beat what I have achieved in the pass. Fortunately, I think j have done it this year.  

The weather was quite intimidating this year. With the prolong rain season, I have to salvage every minute between the clear sky. Not to mentioned the haunting guider and unstable remote connection through my ancient cell phone. 

As my other remote works, I dedicated a lot of imaging time to a single target. The result is satisfying. 

Thanks for reading and clear sky.

-Doug
title: The fireworks in the heart of Andromeda
